glsa.title: fvwm: fvwm-menu-directory fvwm command injection
glsa.synopsis: A flaw in fvwm-menu-directory may permit a local attacker to execute arbitrary commands with the privileges of another user.

background.p: fvwm is a highly configurable virtual window manager for X11 desktops. fvwm-menu-directory allows fvwm users to browse directories from within fvwm.

description.p: Tavis Ormandy of the Gentoo Linux Security Audit Team discovered that fvwm-menu-directory does not sufficiently sanitise directory names prior to generating menus.

impact.p: A local attacker who can convince an fvwm-menu-directory user to browse a directory they control could cause fvwm commands to be executed with the privileges of the fvwm user. Fvwm commands can be used to execute arbitrary shell commands.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
